Ivo H. Daalder WEB.jpg|75px]] |[[Ivo Daalder]] |May 15, 2009 – September 2, 2013 |- |[[File:Douglas Lute 2013.JPG|75px]] |[[Douglas Lute]] |September 3, 2013 – January 20, 2017 |- |[[File:Kay Bailey Hutchison official photo (cropped).jpg|75px]] |[[Kay Bailey Hutchison]] |August 28, 2017 – |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==Sources== *[https://history.state.gov/departmenthistory/people/chiefsofmission/representative-to-nato List of NATO ambassadors — US State Department] *[http://www.nndb.com/gov/407/000120047/ NNDB] ==External links== * {{Official website}} {{USNATOambassadors}} {{Ambassadors of the United States}} {{DEFAULTSORT:United States Permanent Representative To Nato}} [[Category:Lists of ambassadors of the United States|NATO]] [[Category:Permanent Representatives of the United States to NATO| ]] [[Category:NATO-related lists]] [[Category:United States and NATO]] [[Category:United States military policies]]

The '''White Highlands''' is an area in the [[Central Province (Kenya)|central uplands]] of [[Kenya]], so-called because, during the [[British Kenya|period of British colonialism]], European or white immigrants settled there in considerable numbers. They were attracted to the good soils and growing conditions, as well as the cool climate. Many Kenyans use the rich soil to grow crops.<ref name=":0">{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=lsqjN-t6mP4C&pg=PA48|title=Kenya: Identity of a Nation|last=Mwakikagile|first=Godfrey|date=2007|publisher=New Africa Press|year=|isbn=9780980258790|location=|pages=46–47|language=en}}</ref>
The [[East Africa Protectorate]], founded in 1905, encouraged British immigration. By the time the [[Kenya Colony]] was established in 1920, about 10,000 [[British people]] had colonised the area. The colony granted settlers 999-year leases over about 25% of the good land in Kenya. The original indigenous occupants of the land were predominantly from the [[Kalenjin people|Kalenjin]], [[Maasai people|Maasai]] and [[Kikuyu people|Gĩkũyũ]]. Later, members of the Gĩkũyũ and other allied tribes, the [[Embu people|Embu]] and [[Wameru|Meru]] mounted a rebellion against the British control of central Kenya in the [[Mau Mau Uprising]], which was a major factor leading to the country's eventual independence in Dec. 12, 1963.<ref name=":0" /> <!-- [Correction: The claim that the Mau Mau uprising led to Kenya's independence is not supported by facts. The Mau Mau were defeated in 1956. How then could a leaderless routed group then bring independence 7 years later in 1963? The fact is that Kenya's independence happened without any input from the Mau Mau]. -->
The Maasai, who are [[pastoralism|pastoralists]], found the amount of grazing land considerably reduced as the White Highlands expanded.<ref name=":0" />
==See also== *[[East Africa Protectorate]] *[[Happy Valley set]] *[[Kenya Colony]] *[[White people in Kenya]] *[[Hugh Cholmondeley, 3rd Baron Delamere]]

{{about|the place in Norse mythology|the historical region|Álfheimr (region)|other uses|Alfheim (disambiguation)}} [[File:Ängsälvor - Nils Blommér 1850.jpg|thumb|right|300px|''Meadow Elves'', by [[Nils Blommér]], 1850]] '''Alfheim''' ({{Lang-non|Álfheimr}}, "Land Of The Elves" or "Elfland"), also called '''Ljosalfheim''' (''Ljósálf[a]heimr'', "home of the [[Ljósálfar|light-elves]]"), is one of the [[Norse cosmology|Nine Worlds]] and home of the [[Elf#Old_Norse_texts|Light Elves]] in [[Norse mythology]]. ==In Old Norse texts== {{Also|Svartálfaheimr}} Álfheim as an abode of the Elves is mentioned only twice in [[Old Norse]] texts. The [[eddic poem]] ''[[Grímnismál]]'' describes twelve divine dwellings beginning in stanza 5 with:
[[Ýdalir]] call they     the place where [[Ullr|Ull]]
A hall for himself hath set;
And Álfheim the gods     to [[Freyr|Frey]] once gave
As a tooth-gift in ancient times.
A tooth-gift was a gift given to an [[infant]] on the cutting of the first tooth. In the 12th century eddic prose ''[[Gylfaginning]]'', [[Snorri Sturluson]] relates it as the first of a series of abodes in heaven:
That which is called Álfheim is one, where dwell the peoples called ''[[ljósálfar]]'' [Light Elves]; but the ''[[dökkálfar]]'' [Dark Elves] dwell down in the earth, and they are unlike in appearance, but by far more unlike in nature. The Light-elves are fairer to look upon than the sun, but the Dark-elves are blacker than pitch.
The account later, in speaking of a hall in the Highest Heaven called [[Gimlé]] that shall survive when heaven and earth have died, explains:
It is said that another heaven is to the southward and upward of this one, and it is called [[Andlang]] [''Andlangr'' 'Endlong'] but the third heaven is yet above that, and it is called [[Vídbláin]] [''Vídbláinn'' 'Wide-blue'] and in that heaven we think this abode is. But we believe that none but Light-Elves inhabit these mansions now.
It is not indicated whether these heavens are identical to Álfheim or distinct. Some texts read Vindbláin (''Vindbláinn'' 'Wind-blue') instead of Vídbláin. Modern commentators speculate (or sometimes state as fact) that Álfheim was one of the nine worlds (''heima'') mentioned in stanza 2 of the eddic poem ''[[Völuspá]]''. ==See also== * [[Fairyland]] ==References== *''[[Wikisource:Prose Edda/Gylfaginning]] (The Fooling Of Gylfe)'' by Sturluson, Snorri, 13th century Edda, in English. Accessed Apr. 16, 2007 *''Gylfaginning'' in Old Norse[http://www.germanicmythology.com/ProseEdda/BRODEURPrologeandGylfaginning.html Gylfaginning XI-XX] *Robbins, Rossell Hope (1959). ''The Encyclopedia of Witchcraft and Demonology.'' New York: Crown Publishers, Inc. *Bulfinch, Thomas (1834). ''Bulfinch's Mythology.'' New York: Harper & Row, 1970, p. 348. {{ISBN|0-690-57260-3}}. *Marshall Jones Company (1930). ''[[The Mythology of All Races]]'' Series, Volume 2 ''Eddic'', Great Britain: Marshall Jones Company, 1930, pp. 220–221. ==Sources== {{Reflist}} {{Elves}} {{Freyr}} {{Norse cosmology}} {{Norse mythology}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Alfheim}} [[Category:Locations in Norse mythology]] [[Category:Mythological places]] [[Category:Saga locations]] [[Category:Germanic mythology]] [[Category:Elves]] [[Category:Freyr]]
